context_of_use: This use case allows customers to complete checkout using multiple payment methods and track their order status and delivery.
stakeholders_and_interests: customer: wants to complete purchases conveniently and track order status.
description: Allow customers to complete checkout using payment methods and track order status and delivery.
preconditions: Customer has selected products to purchase.
Customer is logged into their account.
postconditions: Customer successfully completes the checkout process.
Customer can view the status of their order.
assumptions: Customer has a valid payment method available.
requirements_met: The system shall allow customers to checkout using multiple payment methods.
The system shall provide order tracking functionality.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the types of payment methods supported.
main_flow: 1. Customer initiates the checkout process → System displays available payment options.
2. Customer selects a payment method → System processes the payment.
3. System confirms the order → System updates order status and provides tracking information.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): If the customer cancels the checkout process, then the system returns to the shopping cart.
AF-2 (from Step 2): If the payment fails, then the system notifies the customer and prompts for a different payment method.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 2): If the system encounters an error during payment processing, then the system logs the error and notifies the customer.
